content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-109-07-B
|Item_parent=Gait and balance disorders
|Item_parent_short=Gait and balance disorders
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the aetiologies of astasia-abasia
|Description=None
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=7}}
- Psychogenic astasia abasia (depressive syndrome, sliding syndrome)

- Secondary astasia-abasia (non-psychogenic): apraxia of walking or frontal ataxia

question.title: What is the primary cause of secondary astasia-abasia?

option_a.title: Psychogenic astasia abasia
option_a.description: A condition caused by a mental health disorder

option_b.title: Secondary astasia-abasia
option_b.description: A condition caused by a neurological disorder

option_c.title: Apraxia of walking
option_c.description: A condition caused by a lack of motor skill learning

option_d.title: Frontal ataxia
option_d.description: A condition caused by damage to the frontal lobe of the brain

correct_option.title: D
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
